title: The Betterment restaurant review: old rivals Jason Atherton and Gordon Ramsay square up
text:
What’s new?

Old rivals Jason Atherton and Gordon Ramsay square up across Grosvenor Square. On the south side, Ramsay’s Lucky Cat; on the north, Atherton’s the Betterment at the Biltmore Mayfair (one of Hilton’s new LXR Hotels and Resorts).

Behind the scenes

With ex-boss (and ex-pal) Ramsay busy stateside, Atherton’s become the face of ‘modern British’, his style status boosted by glossy features about his Thom Sweeney suits and punishing exercise regimen.

Ahead-of-the-curve Atherton found fame at small plates pioneer Maze (now Lucky Cat) in 2005, before cutting ties with Ramsay in 2010 to open Pollen Street Social. This is his 18th site. Paul Walsh of City Social leads the kitchen.
